title: Deceptive Visualizations
description: A project aiming to create deceptive visualizations. On this project I based my deceptive visualizations on percent versus abolute change to show how each one affects the data.

title: Expository Visualization
description: The goal of this project was to communicate an idea based on a small data set. In this I communicated that Whole Foods has consistent outliers in terms of nonprocessed coffee products.

title: Machine Learning with Congressional Voting
description: In this project I used various machine learning techniques on congressional voting data from 1984, asking and answering various questions about the data set.

title: EDA Mini Project
description: A small project experimenting with various EDA methods on a happiness index of countries in 2016.

title: Big Data - Amazon Reviews
description: In this project, I was part of a group and we aimed to predict Amazon review scores, and had to use Spark to work with the massive 50gb+ dataset.

title: EDA Individual Research Project
description: This project involved researching an R package and presenting its function, I researched an R package built around streamlining the EDA process named DataExplorer.

title: Interactive Maps Individual Research Project
description: This project involved researching an R package and presenting what it does. I researched a package named mapview that allowed for the simple creation of interactive maps.

title: NFL Historical Offensive Playstyle Analysis
description: This project's goal was to research and use a technique not taught in the course, give an introduction on the technique, and use the techinque in my own research. I used PCA to determine differences in NFL playstyle throughout history.

title: A Spatial Analysis of the Strike Zone
description: This project aimed to use spatial analysis techniques to analyze Shohei Ohtani as both a pitcher and batter.

title: NFLviz
description: The goal of this project was to freate an R package. As a group we created a package that allowed for the easy creation of visualizations based on NFL data.
